title: Glyphosate Use by Sheffield City Council and Partners 2019-2023

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
In 2021 Sheffield City Council agreed to reduce its use of Glyphosate. Please provide the data to show what progress, if any, is being made. In particular, I would like to know how much Glyphosate has been used by each of the different departments that use it under the auspices of the council, each calendar year from 2019 to the present. I believe Glyphosate is used by Streets Ahead, Housing, Parks, Bereavement and Education but there may be other departments that use it. Please include the data for all of them.
I am aware that Glyphosate is sometimes purchased ready-diluted. Please report figures for undiluted and diluted separately, stating the % of concentration to allow meaningful comparisons to be made.
Yours faithfully,
Graham Wroe

Dear FOI,
Thank you for your response. I still can not make sense of the data you have sent me for Parks. I requested that you put this in a table but you have not done this and I don't understand what the different figures are. I need to be able to compare the figures so I can tell if the actual quantity of undiluted Glyphosate is going up or down. You have set it out clearly for Bereavement Services. Please can you do the same for Parks?
Yours sincerely,
Graham Wroe
